listing.listing_description:
Villa Shambala is a hidden oasis – sophisticated, secluded and exclusive, yet located in the heart of bustling and fashionable Seminyak.

With five elegant ensuite bedrooms – three of them in a privately situated guesthouse – a 19-metre swimming pool, a yoga garden and a spa room, Villa Shambala blends the charm of traditional Indonesian architecture with the luxury and comfort of modern conveniences and interiors. Thoughtful use of space makes this charismatic villa the perfect choice for large groups or families sharing, and a team of friendly staff is dedicated to meeting your every need.

For a central-Seminyak property, Villa Shambala is exceptionally spacious, amazingly peaceful and totally charming. Set within a private walled garden, Shambala effortlessly fuses old and new, borrowing its eclectic style from the intricately carved traditional wooden joglo houses of Java, and blending it with today’s requisite comforts.

Villa Shambala’s master suite features an exquisitely carved joglo canopy above the bed and a huge ensuite garden bathroom. The master and second bedroom sit beyond the living areas, to the rear of the villa, and both overlook a peaceful water feature complete with large stone Buddha and tranquil lily pond. The three guesthouse bedrooms, all ensuite, are arranged around a second television room, brightly decorated and perfect for children. Villa Shambala features a fully equipped media room complete with large screen projector, surround sound system, DVD and satellite television with an extensive library of DVDs, CDs and books for guests’ enjoyment. WiFi is also available throughout the villa.

Leading away from the main building, past circular outdoor lounge seating under a shady ‘sail’ canopy, is a double spa room where guests can enjoy massage and Ayurvedic treatments administered by skilled therapists.

Guests at Villa Shambala are served by a wonderful team of staff including a house manager, private chef, housekeepers, butler, gardeners and security guards, all dedicated to ensuring that you have the perfect holiday.

Villa Shambala enjoys one of the most sought-after locations in Bali, offering guests a complete hidden paradise in Seminyak’s ‘Golden Triangle’. Guests are just minutes from Seminyak’s main street, Jalan Kayu Aya (also called Jalan Laksmana, Oberoi or ‘Eat Street’), where an impressive array of dining and entertainment options abound. Trendy boutiques, supermarkets and ATMs are all within a short walk of the villa, as are some of the island’s best known entertainment and dining venues, such as Ku De Ta, W Hotel, La Lucciola, Potatohead beach club and other glamorous Seminyak staples. Villa Shambala is also just 500 metres from the beach, where guests can enjoy a variety of water sports, long seaside walks and beautiful Bali sunsets.

listing.listing_description:
Listen to the crackling of a wood burning fire as you gaze overtop the lush canopy leading down to Lake Taupo at this nature-loving villa in New Zealand. Sunbathe in the courtyard, kick back in a bean bag chair, and cool off in the alfresco shower. When you’re ready to explore, start by following a nearby bush track that winds through the forest and leads down to the lake.  

Flow from inside to out as freely as the cool cross-breeze thanks to wall-length openings on nearly every perimeter wall. Under a vaulted-ceiling, the open concept main room is ready to host unforgettable family dinners, late nights with friends, and lazy afternoons. Sip cocktails and watch the sailboats from the balcony while the kids watch a movie in the Smart TV lounge or play soccer on the courtyard’s lawn.

Stop by one of the local markets in Taupo and pick up some freshly caught lake fish for a barbeque. Dine at the alfresco set, letting the forest and lake views set the perfect tone. There are 3 parking spaces, a garage, and security cameras, so invite some new friends. When it’s late, move the party inside and let your inner mixologist get creative at the bar.

Lake Taupo, Huka Falls, and Mount Tauhara are just a few of the natural wonders nearby, so bring your hiking boots. If there’s an angler in the group, boat rentals and fishing charters are available from Lakefun Taupo. While you’re out on the water, swing by Taupo Maori Carvings, a historic rockface in Acacia Bay. Then, head 11 kilometers into Taupo for a night on the town. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
A peaked roofline echoes the snow-capped peaks of the mountains at this modern lodge in Glenorchy. Tolkien fans might recognize the area as Middle-Earth; everyone else can spot the landscape in details like local-schist chimneys, cedar-planked walls, and timber floors. Hike the boardwalk to the breathtaking Glenorchy Lagoon and bring your camera to photographer-favorite Glenorchy Wharf.

Make the most of the scenery in outdoor entertaining areas boasting a sunny terrace, a barbecue, and al-fresco dining for eight along with mountain and lake views. If you’ll be on holiday in cooler weather, the house features both gas and wood-burning fireplaces (plus heated floors), and a satellite TV, surround-sound system, and Wi-Fi.

Walls of local wood and stone are just part of the clean-lined architecture of this vacation rental; the other part is glass, framing the views as you catch up with friends and family in the sitting area or perch at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen. It also lines the separate dining room for an al-fresco feel even when you’re indoors.

This luxury property has two bedrooms with king beds, including a master suite; one bedroom with a queen bed; and one bedroom with two twin beds. All four bedrooms have private en-suite bathrooms. Each bedroom is in its own little pavilion laid out around a central courtyard, perfect for couples wanting honeymoon-style privacy.

Wyuna House is set among some of the prettiest scenery in New Zealand—and luckily, it’s easy to get out an explore it. The villa is less than a 10-minute drive from popular hiking and photo spots like Lake Face Creek Falls, Glenorchy Lagoon, and Glenorchy Wharf. Climb Mount Alfred on your own, book a Lord of the Rings–themed tour to spot filming locations, or take a thrilling jet-boat ride on Lake Wakatipu.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Are you in the kitchen or the garden? It’s delightfully tough to tell at this serene open-air villa in southern Bali. Wake up to the sound of birds chirping in the tropical gardens. Sip your morning tea under a beach umbrella while the private chef, part of a full-staff, prepares breakfast. Then, make your way to Petitenget Beach, one of Bali’s best surfing spots for beginners.

Gardens and the swimming pool link Eshara's 2 separate villas. Large openings on Parallel sides of the living room invites a soothing cross-breeze and adds an extra social element to the property. Inside, bright textiles and Balinese artifacts are sure to come up in conversation over dinner. Beneath the extra-high exposed-beam ceilings, you’ll find stylish contemporary furniture and carefully integrated tech features that will satisfy your every need without sacrificing the natural vibes of the villa.

If you’re traveling with the kids, Waterbom and Elephant Safari Parks are perfect for family fun. If you’re feeling adventurous, hike the trails to find scenic lookouts and breathtaking landscapes at Mount Batukaru. Visiting Tanah Lot, an ancient temple built on a rock formation in the sea, is a great idea, especially at sunset. And, if you’re in the mood to dance in the sand under the moonlight, Finn’s Recreation Club one of Bali’s best nightlife hotspots.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Welcome to Villa Cendrawasih, a palatial tropical estate stationed a few short steps from Batubelig Beach in Indonesia’s famed island of Bali. The villa borrows its name from a native bird best known for the flamboyant plumage belonging to the male of the species, which serves as an inspiration for the home’s prodigious design and decor. The villa offers accommodation for up to ten guests with five glamorous bedrooms, a full staff and plentiful amenities.

The villa has a comprehensive and professional staff whose duties are to maintain the estate and to ensure guests enjoy their stay. Among them are four butlers, a gourmet chef, a housekeeper and a chauffeur with a car. The villa is replete with creature comforts including a vast swimming pool and a gym with the latest fitness equipment. One can easily lounge on the furnished terrace, surrounded by gardens and an idyllic Koi fish pod. Inside, the home boasts a multitude of entertainment devices and a security safe to ensure peace of mind.

The interior of Villa Cendrawasih is defined by contemporary decor, with high white walls, smooth stone floors, glistening timber panels and inspirational impressionist art. The main living area has been equipped with comfortable seating and native Indonesian objets d’art. A dining room with an elegant and long candlelit table, promotes an unmistakable air of sophistication to be appreciated over the chef’s gourmet meals.

Villa Cendrawasih’s five en-suite bedrooms feature plush beds and tons of amenities. Rooms either have king beds or two twin beds, which can pushed together to form a king if so desired. The bedrooms also feature convenient direct access to balconies, gardens and the rooftop or ground-floor terrace. Additionally, each room has a personal television, climate control and large closets, leaving guests utterly satisfied.

If you’ve come to Bali to shop for rare and exotic items, nearby Legian Street is the place to be. The street is literally lined with fashion boutiques and art shops where haggling is part of the local custom. Bali is also a sacred place, home to countless temples which are visited by steadfast though friendly pilgrims who invite newcomers to learn and participate in some of their customs. Tanah Lot Temple is one such site, situated offshore atop an outcrop, and is one of Bali’s most dazzling iconic sites.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Just steps from the beach, this breezy open-concept three-bedroom celebrates Hawaii’s gorgeous natural environment in luxurious fashion. With its wrap-around lanai and unobstructed floor-to-ceiling opening, fresh ocean air and warm natural sunlight fill the penthouse with ease. When it’s time to check out the beach, simply take the elevator downstairs and follow the path, you’ll be there in no time. If you’d like to get out and do some exploring, you’ll find nightlife in Kihei, shopping, and legendary golf at Wailea Blue Golf Course.

With a bright and cheerful open-air atmosphere, you’re sure to experience the relaxing Hawaiian way of life at this penthouse. The decor is a mix of plush designer furniture, rich wood textures, eclectic local works of art, and high-end electronics. The kitchen features stained wood cabinetry, granite countertops, and stainless steel appliances that are sure to inspire culinary creativity. And, the balcony is the perfect place to enjoy a relaxing evening.

The Wailea penthouse comes equipped with cable television, a sound system, Wi-Fi, air conditioning, and a washer/dryer. There’s formal dining space inside for six, and an alfresco set with seating for eight on the balcony. Shared amenities include a swimming pool, hot tub, fitness center, billiards room, and a shuttle service that transports guests to nearby luxury resorts.

If you’d like to visit more of Maui’s beautiful beach area, you won’t have to travel far. There are three more beaches within a ten-minute drive of the Wailea Community. Also nearby, The Shops at Wailea is an open-air mall with over sixty stores by luxury fashion brands, and it’s a great place to have lunch with its many restaurants. If you’ve got a golfer in the group, the Blue Course is a must-play. Blue winds through the resort area and along the coast, offering spectacular ocean views. And, from a few of the holes, you’ll be able to see Mount Haleakala, one of Hawaii’s most picturesque, dormant volcanoes.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

HAWAII TAX ID #: 016-608-2560-01

listing.listing_description:
Villa Lulito is an elegant colonial retreat located at the pulsing heart of chic Seminyak just moments away from Petitenget beach on Bali’s sunset coast.  This fully staffed villa sets a stylish tone as a tropical getaway for families or groups. Four white plantation-style pavilions border a 15-metre azure pool that forms an outstanding centrepiece for a small soiree.  The two-level sleeping pavilion houses four luxurious bedrooms while three sleek open living areas provide a collection of zones to chill, engage or play.  Chose between formal feasts in the smart dining area or casual alfresco meals at the dining table nestled within the villa’s lush gardens.

As you approach Villa Lulito via the sophisticated shopping and dining enclave of Oberoi, rubbing shoulders with iconic Bali landmarks including the super-cool Ku De Ta and the elegant hotel after which the area is named, it is obvious that the villa can lay claim to an exclusive and coveted location.  And once beyond the threshold of this luxurious villa oasis, Australian interior designer Stuart Membery’s tribute to Ralph Lauren’s polished Caribbean style is also pleasingly obvious: everything from the beautifully hand-rendered walls along the drive and the majestic custom-made Aegean blue doorway, to the soft-cushioned rattan chairs, white shutters and maritime motifs coupled with exposed timber beam ceilings and hurricane lamps, evokes refined empire. Think Montego Bay meets Bali.

Families, couples or friends will adore soaking up the charm of this 2011-built residence, which has four generous ensuite bedrooms, including a delightful kids room with four bunks and the option to add another king-size bed (extra charge),  and plenty of living space.  Two bedrooms flank the villa’s double entranceway and face the pool, while above them two more suites open onto a long balcony overlooking the azure water, which is lit at night by neon blue lights creating a mesmerising aquatic art piece.  Relax into one of several comfortable living rooms that meander through the pavilions and include a quiet alcove with plush sofas for watching television, perusing the library, listening to music or enjoying an aperitif.  Landscape gardener Bruce Johnson created a kaleidoscope of tropical gardens that fringe the pavilions.

A two-storey pavilion houses all four ensuite, air-conditioned and fan-cooled bedrooms at Villa Lulito – two at pool level and two on the floor above, accessed from a long, white, covered balcony.  Plantation shutters, rattan trunks and lush potted palms create a serene environment that is perfect for holiday downtime. The Master suite can easily convert to a family suite by sliding open the double doors in the dressing area to connect with the adjacent children’s room.

A dedicated staff team provides five-star service and expertly prepare gourmet delights to be served in one of three dining areas from casual in the gleaming kitchen to a timelessly set table for eight in the formal dining room.  Everything is at your fingertips, including massage beds that are just waiting for a therapist to be called to deliver expert treatments.

Step outside and you are at the centre of Bali’s best shopping district, with hip cafes, fabulous nightclubs and fine restaurants to chose from.  One of the island’s most important Hindu temples and glorious Seminyak beach are just a stroll away.  Breathe in the sea air and get your holiday rocking from this perfectly placed villa.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Adasa offers traditional Balinese construction, with open concept balés, or pavilions, that allow one to constantly appreciate the verdant and tropical setting. Near the island’s southwestern coast in a central location known as Petitenget, the villa’s three guest bedrooms can accommodate a total of six individuals. Come to Bali, Indonesia’s premier vacation destination and stay at Villa Adasa for the experience of a lifetime.

Guests staying here will be attended to by the villa’s four butlers who work alongside the chef, housekeeper, security guard and gardener. Villa Adasa has a fourteen foot greenstone-tiled swimming pool and a traditional balé furnished with large daybeds perfect for those precious idle moments. The home has been upgraded to include the latest in entertainment technology, including an elite Sonos sound system and Wi-Fi. The decked roof above is perfect for either sunbathing, yoga or casual hangouts.

The interior decor of Villa Adasa is a feast for the eyes, consisting of colorful Batik cushions, ornate Turkish rugs and monochromatic prints dated from the 1930s. The vaulted ceilings here are either thatched with alang-alang grass in the traditional Balinese style or elegant ironwood shingles, while the walls are made of attractive Palimanan stone and the flooring consists of either terrazzo or teakwood. Additionally, the kitchen comes fully-equipped and features an inviting and large breakfast bar.

Three bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms will give guests a luxurious and comfy spot in which to rest and unwind in total privacy. The master suite is located on the second floor and boasts a king size bed in addition to an amply sized sitting area, wall-length wardrobes, mountain view and balcony access. The two bedrooms on the ground floor each have two twin beds, a dressing area and direct access to the terrace.

If you’ve come to Bali to enrich your soul and have fun, then you’re in luck because Villa Adasa is near almost all of Bali’s top attractions. Petitenget Beach is just a stone’s throw away and has ideal waves for surfing. If surfing doesn’t cut it, then try Waterbom Bali, the island’s fun water park that provides a cool refreshing splash for children of all ages. For a taste of the local fare, the so-called ‘Eat Street’ found in nearby Jalan Laksmana will delight your taste buds and satiate your appetite.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Sleek lines, sensational views and sophisticated interiors, matched with comfort, space and a treasure trove of top-notch facilities, give The Iman Villa a wide appeal. This luxurious residence is as perfect for fun family get-togethers as it is for elegant soirees and unforgettable weddings. Witness a spectacular Bali sunset from the rooftop hot tub; sip cocktails in the sunken lounge; soak up the sun as the kids splash in the wading pool; relax – you’re on holiday. The Iman Villa’s rural setting belies the fact that Seminyak’s excellent restaurant, bars and boutiques are within easy reach – although, with such fabulous facilities, attentive staff and gourmet meals on hand you may just be tempted to stay put.

The combination of chic modern design aesthetics and a picturesque Balinese setting among lush paddy fields, towering palm groves and leafy banana plantations, gives The Iman Villa an undeniable ‘wow’ factor.  Built on gently sloping grassy terraces that mimic the surrounding rice fields, you will feel very much a part of the tropical scene, while enjoying it from a luxurious vantage point offering every conceivable modern comfort.  Cutting edge features to enhance your stay include Apple TV, massive plasma screens and the sleekest of fittings.

Gleaming under the tropical skies, the white stone buildings are reminiscent of the Mediterranean, while eco-friendly ‘green’ roofs topped with plants and water features blend in with the natural environment.  A distinctive Indonesian flavour is reflected in the intriguing collection of copper lamps, ethnic artefacts, wood carvings and antiques, handpicked by the owners and displayed throughout the villa.

As well as being the ultimate in designer villas, The Iman is also hit with families.  Kids will love the wading pool, plethora of floating toys, rooftop hot tub, snooker table and terraced lawns. The pizza oven is bound to make them happy too.  When it comes to groups, the infinity pool and open-sided living area with its decadent sunken lounge makes a perfect social hub.  There’s a smaller lounge, dining and kitchen area in the two-bedroomed guesthouse, so options for privacy are ample.

Beautifully presented gourmet meals are served up by the villa’s talented private chef, who has a background in fine dining.  Friendly and attentive butlers can also whip you up a signature drink or stock the wine fridge with your favourite tipple.

While the village of Pererenan is still sleepy and rural, nearby Echo Beach is famed for its sunsets and seafood barbecues, and the neighbouring district of Batubolong has recently started to buzz with a laid-back beach vibe.  Here you will find a trendy assortment of cafes, bars, spas, boutiques and beachfront restaurants.

listing.listing_description:
Explore the peace and serenity of the Balinese at this open-air villa 5 minutes from the beach in Kecamatan Kuta Utara. Catch up on a little reading beneath the shade of the poolside pergola. Practice yoga or work on your tan in the secluded lawn area or on the rooftop patio. Once you’ve melted the last bits of stress away, head to Uluwatu Temple for a history lesson in Balinese Culture.

Follow serene water features, exotic gardens, and warm wood flooring through Villa Mundano’s open-atmosphere and celebrate the beautiful environment of Indonesia. The open-walled dining room is a perfect setting for a traditional meal prepared by the in-house chef. Once the sun has set, treat yourself to rejuvenating soak in the master bedroom’s spa-like bathtub or late-night dip in the swimming pool.

During your stay, you’ll appreciate housekeeping, chef and butler services, and security. The villa comes with parking and add-on airport transfer, tours, and excursion packages. If you’re keeping up with the outside world, there’s cable television in the media room, Wi-Fi, several secluded spots to sneak away for a few quick emails.

Touring the area by horseback is a fun and relaxing way to connect with nature. The Bali Equestrian Centre is 4 minutes from home and offers a variety of tour packages and lessons. After exploring the land, hit Berawa Beach for a swim. In the evening, Finn’s Beach Club, featuring 4 pools, 9 bars, and 5 restaurants, is the place to be if you feel like dancing.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Postcard-perfect views are framed by chic contemporary architecture at Lakefront Luxury. Set in the hills above Queenstown, this thoughtfully designed, recently built vacation rental boasts sweeping panoramas of Lake Wakatipu and the mountains beyond. Its four bedrooms are ideal for a golf getaway with friends or a ski holiday with family.

Start the day with a morning coffee or a leisurely soak on the villa’s private north-facing deck, which has an al-fresco dining table and hot tub, then read or relax on the front balcony, which has glass railings for uninterrupted lake and mountain views. Heat up the barbecue and linger outside into the evening, or unwind inside in the media room, which has Sky TV, a sound system and Wi-Fi.

The split-level design of Lakefront Luxury takes full advantage of its spectacular setting. On the top floor, you’ll find an open-concept space with two living areas separated by a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar and formal dining area. The room is flooded with light from nearly wall-to-wall windows, and even the fireplace is low-profile so as not to break up the vistas outside.

All four of the villa’s bedrooms have king beds, en-suite bathrooms, and views of the lake and mountains, and open to a private balcony. All except one of the king beds can be split into two twin beds if desired.

At only a 10-minute drive from the Queenstown airport, Lakefront Luxury puts you close to South Island adventure. It’s a 15-minute drive to the nearest ski area, at Coronet Peak, and an even shorter drive to your choice of two golf courses. For shopping, dining, nightlife or even a honeymoon-worthy cruise on the lake, make the 15-minute walk into central Queenstown.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This four-bedroom vacation home is nestled in a secret corner of Bali’s bumping Seminyak district and can offer eight fortunate travelers a chance to see Indonesia’s ‘Island of the Gods’ from the comfort of a well developed strip of land, while remaining in proximity Bali’s natural beauty. Designed by Indonesia’s own Budi Pradono, Villa Issi is an amazing example of contemporary architecture blending seamlessly with its laidback tropical surroundings. Simply stated, there could be no better choice than Villa Issi to start off an exciting Balinese expedition.

Villa Issi is ideal for bon vivants. Guests are invited to sit back and let the estate’s staff chef, butler and housekeeper take care of things, while they indulge in the eighty-foot emerald green swimming pool. The estate also boasts a fitness facility as well as a gourmet barbeque for sumptuous meals at the alfresco dining table. Indoors, guests can enjoy the big screen television and the Bose sound system.

The design found in this home is nothing short of phenomenal. There is a stunning artistic metal sculpture that wraps around the top floor and provides shade for two of the bedrooms. The living room has a monochromatic color scheme with soft, vibrantly colored furnishings, producing a great contrasting effect. There is also a very unique, timber bridge that extends from the upper-floor deck over the swimming pool.

Two bedrooms are located on the upper floor in the main house and the other two can be found in the separate guest house. Each bedroom has plush king size beds and en-suite bathrooms with alfresco features. Additionally, every room has a separate entrance to the terrace, except for the master suite, which has its own balcony and scenic views.

Villa Issi is within walking distance of the busy streets of Seminyak, full of charming vendors who love to haggle over their exotic wares. High-end restaurants can also be found here, or as they’re called on this island, a warung, as well as hip beach clubs full of lively people. If you’re looking for some cultural authenticity, the iconic Tanah Lot temple is a mere thirty minutes away, providing the dramatic scene of an ancient temple that literally rises out from the sea atop a rock archway.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Slip into the unhurried pace of life in rural Bali at Villa Shinta Dewi. Set on a private lot outside Tegallantang, a quiet village just minutes from livelier Ubud, this four-bedroom contemporary vacation rental is surrounded by lush forest. Let the attentive staff take care of your needs as you relax with friends and family in an ambience of thoughtful modern luxury.

It’s tempting to remain at the villa to stretch out on a lounger in the sun, swim in the heated pool or sip a drink in the shade of the pavilion. A barbecue and al-fresco dining area make it easy to whip up a casual dinner, and a home gym and massage room help you keep up with your routine.

Furnished and frequented by the owners, the villa is thoughtfully appointed with stylish pieces in luxe finishes. The great room, which stretches across the front of the house, can be opened to the pool terrace; together with the primarily white color scheme, it gives the space a bright, airy feel. Soft sectionals in the sitting area are set off by orange accents and a relief on the feature wall, while in the dining area, the solid wood table has heft. The chef’s kitchen is fully equipped with everything from champagne flutes to martini glasses.

Each of the four bedrooms at Villa Shinta Dewi has an en-suite bathroom and opens to a terrace or shared balcony. The master suite has a king bed and jetted tub, two bedrooms have two twin beds (which can be converted to king beds) and one bedroom has a queen bed. As in the great room, sunlight spills into the bedrooms through large wood-framed windows and sliding doors for a warm, inviting atmosphere.

Though the villa is meant to be an escape to a quiet area where rice farmers work and traditional temples dot the roads, it’s not far from the livelier parts of Seminyak. You’ll find more and more local businesses, from cafés to batik studios, opening in the neighborhood, and for an array of shopping, dining and nightlife options, make the short drive to central Ubud, popular with everyone from backpackers to couples on honeymoon. For a one-of-a-kind excursion, drive to the nearby Taro Elephant Safari Park or Bali Bird Park.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Set in the middle of emerald green rice paddies, with views of your own golf course and the ocean in the distance, Villa Mandalay is a tranquil escape from the everyday. Tucked away in the small village of Munggu, the seven-bedroom private villa feels like your own exclusive five-star resort, but is still close to the beach, restaurants, local nightlife and other popular things to do in Bali.

Your stay at Villa Mandalay begins with a welcome drink and fruit basket, and includes the services of a chef, housekeeper, property manager and security personnel. Spend your trip enjoying Bali’s famously balmy weather on a lounge chair on the terrace, taking refreshing swims in the private pool, practicing your putt on your own (small-scale) golf course or trying out local specialties on the barbecue. In the evenings, watch the sunset from the open-air dining pavilion, surrounded by a water feature and beyond, the countryside. Inside, the villa has a bar and media room for entertaining and a Finnish-style sauna and Wi-Fi for quiet moments.

The views and luxurious style of Villa Mandalay make it the best place to stay in Bali. Inspired by traditional Indonesian estates, the property is laid out as a series of pavilions surrounding the stone-tiled pool, guaranteeing privacy. In the main pavilion, two built-in, open-sided sitting areas flank a large formal dining area and chic bar, while the mezzanine-level media room is tucked under a peaked ceiling for a more intimate feel. Throughout the villa, Indonesian paintings and statues make for intriguing focal points. Though chef service is included in your stay, the villa does have a fully equipped kitchen as well.

Each of the seven bedrooms at Villa Mandalay has a king bed, en-suite bathroom and air conditioning; the two master suites have private terraces, too. Like the main pavilion, the bedrooms use creamy stone, ironwood roofs and dark wood accents to create a serene, inviting feel. Many of the bedrooms feature large sliding glass doors that can be opened to let the scents of frangipani, calla lilies and more waft in on warm breezes from the garden.

During your stay, don’t miss classic Bali experiences like a stroll along the black sands of Seseh Beach, just under 3 km from the villa, or a visit to the Tanah Lot Sea Temple, 13 km away. (Other beaches in the Seseh area have breaks if you want to surf, or reefs that are beautiful for scuba diving.) Practice on the villa’s private golf course before heading off for a round at Nirwana Bali Golf Course, 13 km away, and find world-class shopping and dining in Seminyak, 12 km away. Also close by are the town of Pererenan, 3 km away, and the Finns Recreation Club, just over 7 km away, featuring a fitness center and water park. The nearest airport is Ngurah Rai International, a 21 km drive from Villa Mandalay.

Copyright © 2016 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Warm your toes by the fire while gazing out over Lake Wakatipu at the aptly named Supreme Lakefront. Floor-to-ceiling windows showcase views of the water and mountains from the open-concept rooms of this modern hideaway. After a day of golf, skiing, or simply relaxing, book a table at one of Queenstown’s tempting restaurants, and hop a water taxi from the villa’s jetty to make your reservation.

 

On warm days, you can savor some of Kelvin Height’s best views from private outdoor living areas with plenty of loungers, al-fresco dining for 8, and a barbecue; on cooler evenings, linger around the fire pit or soak in the outdoor hot tub before heading inside to turn on the satellite TV, integrated sound system, and gas fireplace. In addition to the usual Wi-Fi, this luxury property also has the unexpected touch of heated floors.

 

While the oversized windows flood the great room with light, a gray fireplace surround and black wall of cabinets anchor the living room, dining area for 8, and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar. Follow the doors that flank the fireplace to a second sitting area that feels like a conservatory, with glass on three sides.

 

This vacation rental has 3 bedrooms with king beds and en-suite bathrooms, including one with its own kitchenette and lounge area that’s perfect for in-laws or a couple wanting honeymoon-style privacy. For groups on holiday with the whole family, including the younger set, there’s also a children’s room with twin bunk beds, 2 twin beds and access to a hall bathroom.

 

Though Supreme Lakefront is removed from the bustle of Queenstown, it’s still within easy reach of the area’s attractions. The villa is a short drive from Remarkable Golf Tours and within day-trip distance of the ski slopes at Coronet Peak. It’s also 15 kilometers or less to the challenge of Queenstown Golf Course, the serenity of Queenstown Gardens, the thrills of Skyline Queenstown, and the shops and restaurants in the center of town.

 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Sepoi Sepoi means "Sea Breeze" in Bahasa and is situated on the North Western coast of the beautiful island of Lombok. It is an exclusive hideaway villa designed by the well-known British architect, Jane Taylor and is just a short flight away from Bali, Perth and Singapore.

A holiday at the villa will be a family experience to be cherished. A place to relax and escape the pressures of home and work. A chance to play with the children in a stunning and safe environment and take long, unhurried walks up and down the beach. It is a fantastic location to completely unwind by the pool or at the bar. As dusk settles, blend up delicious island cocktails and ease into the hot tub for a soak under the stars.

Your personal chef will serve you delicious, fresh and local feasts while seated either at the villa or on the beach. The ultimate alfresco dining experience. Inside, fresh ocean breezes pass through an invisible wall into the open-plan main room. High, vaulted ceilings lined with wicker matting complement the rustic wood tones giving the home a traditional feel, while custom furniture and carefully selected tables and accessories add taste and refinement.

Smooth hardwood floors underpin all six unique bedrooms. Each has a sliding door opening onto the terrace and features soft linens, comfortable beds and ocean views. You’ll also find a well-appointed en-suite bathroom with premium fixtures and safe in every bedroom. The Gold Master bedroom has an air conditioner, ceiling fan, sitting area, massage room and a balcony.

For the adventurous in the group, there is the opportunity to climb Mount Rinjani or play a round of golf at the stunning 18 holes Kosaido course next door. A snorkel and dive around the tropical coral of the Gili islands is just 5 minutes by boat from the villa. 

Copyright © 2015 Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
This spectacular villa is perched above a pristine beach at the southernmost tip of Bali’s Buket Peninsula, with truly breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean. Situated within the private Asmara Estate, the villa is within walking distance of Timbis Cliffs and about five kilometers from Nusa Dua town. Resort-style features include a superb infinity pool, in-residence spa facilities, a game room, and a fabulous private staff including a talented chef. The three-story villa includes five bedroom suites—four with king beds, one with two twins—making it an ideal choice for destination wedding guests, large groups of friends, or unforgettable family reunions.

The contemporary architectural masterwork balances top-of-the-line comforts with traditional Balinese influences, harmonizing beautifully with the timeless seaside setting. Multiple outdoor living areas form an ideal venue for festive occasions or serene relaxation in utter privacy. Relish a refreshing dip in the swimming pool and bask on comfortable sunbeds. Sip cocktails in the shaded pavilion and gather for alfresco meals in pergola, cooled by afternoon shadows or illuminated by beautiful lanterns.

The terrace flows gracefully into the villa’s luminous interiors, where a superb guest kitchen serves a lovely open-plan living area with lounge and dining table overlooking the terrace and sea. The entertainment room with balcony is well appointed for nighttime fun, while the exquisite den inspires serene concentration. The lower floor includes the spa and fitness center, featuring a wide array of treatments and equipment to choose from.

All five bedrooms enjoy ocean views and ensuite bathrooms. Each of the king suites opens to a private balcony, while the twin bedroom borders the terrace. The superb master suite features a jetted tub in its bathroom, and there are soaking tubs in the bathrooms attached to two of the guest suites.

The beach beneath you is ideal for swimming and snorkeling, with a coral reef creating a safe sanctuary of gentle waters. Walk about half-kilometer to the paragliding at Timbis Cliff, or enjoy a chauffeured ride to Nusa Dua town or Bali National Golf Club. Families will enjoy Pirates Bay and Jimbaran Beach (famed for its seafood), while Uluwatu Temple offers a profound experience of Bali's spiritual heritage.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Modern style and a gorgeous natural setting are a perfect marriage at Noku Beach House. Hidden away in a walled garden and serviced by an attentive staff, this rare beachfront Seminyak vacation rental is an oasis of true luxury. It’s an incredible retreat for groups of up to twelve—or a stunning setting for a family reunion or Bali destination wedding.

Your holiday at the beach house includes the services of a chef, butler, housekeeper and groundskeeper, as well as security staff. Spend your time lounging in the sun on the terrace, splashing in a 27-meter-long pool that stretches toward the horizon or napping in the shade of the balé. Rinse off in the outdoor shower before sitting down at the al-fresco table or wandering inside to enjoy the media room, wet bar and Wi-Fi.

While the villa’s architecture frames the breathtaking Indian Ocean views, equally picture-perfect interiors by Alex Zabotto-Bentley offer a fresh, contemporary take on the beach house. Stretch out on the sectional and set your cocktail on one of the chic and convenient low tables scattered in the living room, or gather in the sculptural armchairs around the dining table. Though chef service is included, there is a fully equipped kitchen.

The honeymoon from everyday life continues in the villa’s six bedrooms. There are three with king beds and three with two twin beds each; all six have private en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning and ceiling fans, and open to a balcony or patio.

A stay at Noku Beach House puts you right on Seminyak Beach, just a short drive from several popular restaurants and resorts, and a quick trip from the lively town of Kuta. Don’t miss the chance to explore the town of Canggu or the impressive Uluwatu Temple on the sea.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Let soaring mountains, green forests, and shimmering lakes inspire you at this stylish hilltop home in Rotorua, New Zealand. The wrap-around deck is a perfect place to work on your tan, do some grilling, and dine alfresco with friends and family. After an Espresso at the breakfast bar, set out to Lake Rotorua, the Waitomo Caves, or Tongariro National Park. 

A classic black-and-white color scheme sets a chic tone, especially against the striking greens and blues the Rotorua Basin. Exotic timber decking outlines Tihi’s interior. Wall-to-wall openings let you flow as freely as the breeze, adding a refreshing element to social occasions. In the kitchen, let your culinary creativity run wild, top of the line stainless steel appliances are waiting to assist. 

Stretch out on the sofa by the gas fireplace and settle in for a movie night with the family. When the kids are in bed, make your way out the terrace and do some star gazing, they are amazing in New Zealand. If you’ve decided to stay in contact with the real world, Wi-Fi and Smart TVs will help. If not, walk down the steps to sun loungers and lose yourself in a good book or podcast. 

Craving some excitement? Jump out of a plane, shoot some rapids, or carve a path down a snow-covered mountain, extreme sports a way of life in New Zealand. For something a little more relaxing, check out the mud baths and hot springs at Hell’s Gate or stroll along the boardwalk at the geothermal park in Rotorua’s city center. Sunsets are incredible from the park. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Experience true luxury, Bali style, at Windu Sari. Though it’s separated from the bustle by a gated estate, this stylish vacation rental is close to beautiful beaches, trendy restaurants and clubs, and shopping in fashionable Petitenget. Reserve its four bedrooms for an indulgent holiday overseen by the villa’s full staff, or book it as part of the larger Windu Estate to celebrate a special occasion with friends and family.

A lush garden forms the private setting for this tropical haven. The courtyard features a 14-meter pool, loungers in the sun, a poolside bale, al-fresco dining and a barbecue, while inside, the villa’s amenities range from a media room and fitness area to satellite television and Wi-Fi. Your stay at Windu Sari also includes the services of a chef, housekeeper, butler and nighttime guard.

Inspired by traditional Balinese architecture, the villa takes indoor-outdoor living to new levels with its lofty ceilings, open layout and louvered doors. Wood beams and accents lend warmth to the sitting and dining areas, and polished marble floors extend from the terrace indoors for a seamless feel. The fully equipped kitchen is a state-of-the-art showpiece with sleek cabinetry and a convenient central island.

Windu Sari has two bedrooms with king beds and two bedrooms with two twin beds each; all four bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and open to balconies. Teak floors, clean-lined furnishings and exuberantly patterned textiles give each bedroom suite a distinctive flair.

From the villa, it’s less than a 10-minute walk to the restaurants and boutiques lining Jalan Petitenget or the white sands of Legian Beach. You can take a honeymoon-worthy stroll all the way from Kuta to Canggu on the nearby Petitenget Beach—or stop along the way for a cocktail at one of the oceanfront bars. Make the short drive to Seminyak Square for a relaxing day at your choice of several spas or a lively night out in its famous clubs.

Windu Sari can be rented as part of a larger estate, Windu Estate (https://www.luxuryretreats.com/vacation-rentals/indonesia/bali/petitenget/windu-estate-114865). 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Making the most of Maui’s gorgeous weather and balmy beach environment is easy in Wailea’s open-air beach residence. Just a short walk from the villa and you’ll be on the sandy shores, enjoying the crystal clear waters, and melting stress away under the Hawaiian sun. Nearby, you’ll find shopping, golf, state parks, plenty more public beaches, and the vibrant city of Kihei.

Situated on the corner of the second floor of Wailea’s Beach Residence, this villa offers a living room/terrace combination like no other. With sliding glass doors that tuck away into the wall, the living room opens, barrier-free, to the covered terrace, creating an extremely generous common area, great for hosting. The covered portion of the terrace acts more like a second apartment, with an outdoor kitchen, lounge area, dining set, and view of Maui’s lush tropical greenery. Inside, granite countertops, marble flooring, warm wood tones, and high-end electronics decorate the open concept spaces.

Wailea Beach Residence offers three en-suite bedrooms, two with king beds and the third features two doubles. The villa is equipped with Wi-Fi, air conditioning, cable television, and a washer/dryer. On the Wailea estate, you’ll have shared access to their swimming pools, hot tubs, fitness center, billiards room, and a shuttle service that transports guests to other luxury resorts nearby. Parking and housekeeping are also included.

Maui’s western coast is a favorite among snorkelers, divers, and sunbathers, with its clear, calm water, and pristine white sands. The nearby town of Kihei is home to the National Marine Sanctuary, an excellent spot to see Humpback Whales. Boat tours and fishing excursions are also available in Kihei. And, perhaps Hawaii’s most famous natural features, Haleakala and Puu Kukui volcanoes are both within driving distance.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Please note that these properties have open plans and privacy between bedrooms may be limited. Please speak with your Villa Specialist for more detail. 

Combine 2 neighboring villas and invite even more friends to the party at this Harbor view hillside estate in New Zealand. Stargaze from the hot tubs on wrap-around decks, dine alfresco amongst lush greenery and catch up on some reading while sailboats navigate the harbor below. After a hike through the estate's private trails, check out nearby golf courses, wineries, and beaches. 

Group gatherings are a breeze at Kauri Hill Estate, but when you'd like to sneak away with that special someone, that's when you'll truly appreciate the 2 separate houses. The kids will love watching movies and hanging out in the smaller lounges while the adults turn up the sound system in the main room. When the party inevitably moves to the terrace, fire up the grill and turn it into a barbeque. 

Catch the big game on satellite television, and invite some friends, there's parking for 7 and a helipad. If you're playing host, the combined dinner seating for the estate is 14 inside and 14 alfresco. After dinner, let your inner mixologist shine and get crafty with a few cocktails in the kitchen. And, don't worry about the heat, both villas are fully air-conditioned. 

Cycling enthusiasts and thrill seekers will want to test out the trails at Waitangi Forest. Whether you're into long distance or mountain biking, you'll find what you're looking for in the forest. Want to get out on the water? Go after some blue and Stripped Marlin in Whangaroa Harbor, fishing charters are readily available. Then, shoot at round at Kauri Cliffs, a favorite stop on the PGA Tour. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Climb into a hammock and sway with the sea breeze at this beach house in Hawaii’s beautiful Waikoloa Beach Resort. Cool off on a hot afternoon in the refreshing swimming pool. At night, move over to the lagoon-style hot tub and melt all your stress away. The next morning, walk 2-minutes to Anaeho’omalu Bay and stroll along the sand while you plan out an exciting day on the Big Island.

Warm, earthy tones, intricate wood features, and lush gardens show off Hawaii’s style at Hale Kolea Kai. Stretch out in a sun lounger to work on your tan. Find a shady spot beneath a palm tree to do a little reading. Or, hang out inside and enjoy the air conditioning in this modern beach house. If you’re in the mood to embrace the Hawaiian culture, fire up the barbecue, and mix up a few tropical drinks for an unforgettable evening.

Take the kids to Kolea Amenity Center children’s pool, which features a sand bottom and a waterfall. While they’re splashing around in the pool, relax in the natural lava rock hot tub. After, stop for lunch or do a little shopping in the resort’s entertainment area. If you feel like exploring the island, the Hawai’i Volcanoes National Park is the perfect place to snap a few vacation photos.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Ambra is a marvelous, beachfront villa on the southwest shore of Bali. Situated within Pantai Lima Estates—an enclave of five extraordinary homes—the villa's prime location places you within easy reach of both Canguu and Seminyak, while offering a rare degree of privacy and extraordinary ocean views. Five bedroom suites accommodate ten guests, making it an ideal vacation rental for families and groups of friends. Complimentary features include chef service, security, housekeeping, a property manager, and two five-seater cars with drivers.

The villa's outdoor living areas are nestled amid lush, tropical gardens and trees with panoramic views of the coast and sea. Elegant loungers and a crescent-shaped table overlook the pool, while a half-moon lounge is perfectly placed for sunset cocktails. Enjoy quiet afternoons in the stand-alone pavilion with comfortable beds, or play games of pingpong on the shaded patio. Gather for alfresco meals at the lovely table perched above the beach, and crawl into the whirlpool spa at night for a soak beneath the stars.

Beautiful French doors join the pool patio with the home's interiors, inviting fresh ocean breezes into the home. The classic Balinese villa features vaulted ceilings, spacious salon areas, and a gorgeous dining table of polished timber. There is a lovely library for quiet downtime, and a massage bale is set beside an extraordinary carved stone relief.

The villa features four bedroom suites with king beds and one suite with a queen bed, and all have ensuite bathrooms. The master bathroom includes a soaking tub, and two of the guest bathrooms are semi-alfresco. Air conditioning, ceiling fans, safes, and TVs help create lovely private sanctuaries for downtime and rest.

Villa Ambra boasts one of the finest locations in this region of southern Bali. Along with your private stretch of beach, you're within minutes of Echo Beach and the popular beach and nightlife hubs of Canggu and Seminyak. Golfers are less than ten kilometers from Nirwana Bali, and Tanah Lot Temple is also minutes away. Ngurah Rai International Airport is less than twenty kilometers away, making the villa a convenient choice for destination wedding guests.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Delicate orchids and verdant coconut palms are just part of the garden of delights at this traditionally inspired, fully staffed villa on the east coast of Bali. Warm teak runs across the terrace and onto the great room ceiling, and open walls welcome breezes. Watch fishing boats ply the waters of Labuan Amuk Bay, just in front of the house, and drive 3 minutes to Anom and Candidasa beaches.

Start holiday mornings with a coffee sipped in one of the villa’s shaded outdoor living areas, then bring a book or podcast to a lounger in the sun by the swimming pool. Cool off with refreshments from the wet bar as you heat up the barbecue for lunch or dinner at the alfresco table for 10. Stretch out in the private gym—or in front of the satellite TV, Sonos sound system, and Wi-Fi.

This vacation rental has all the hallmarks of classic Indonesian style, from white walls topped by sloping roofs to vaulted ceilings supported by exposed wooden beams. It’s laid out around an open-concept second-floor great room—all the better to catch the ocean breeze—with a sitting area, dining area for 10, and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar.

Each of the 4 bedrooms at this luxury property has a king bed, ensuite bathroom, air conditioning, and access to either a balcony or terrace. Details like four-poster beds draped in gauzy curtains and small sitting areas give the bedrooms honeymoon-suite-worthy appeal.

The villa’s Manggis location puts you a 3-minute drive from the hotel-lined stretches of Anom and Candidasa beaches. It’s less than a 10-minute drive to Tenganan Ancient Village, where you can see how local traditions are still honored in the crafting of ikat cloth, and there are several temples and water palaces in the area, one of which has a restaurant run by the royal family.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Surround yourself with water—and gorgeous waterfront views—at The Peninsula. This beautifully designed vacation rental is set along tranquil canals in a private residential enclave, but is only a 10-minute drive from downtown Noosa Heads and Sunshine Beach. Reserve its four bedrooms for a family getaway to the beach or a holiday in the Queensland sun with friends.

Watch the sun sparkling on the water from outdoor living areas with an infinity pool, hot tub, gas barbecue, wine fridge and al-fresco dining for eight. There’s also a boat ramp if you’d like to set off on an excursion, and shared access to a boat dock. After sunset, flip on the streaming TV or catch up with friends back at home via Wi-Fi.

The villa’s thoughtful design allows guests the luxury of water views from nearly every room. Fold-away glass walls are all that separates the terrace from the living room, where louvered windows encourage the breeze, and a pair of sofas invite you to settle in by the TV. The adjacent dining area seats ten, and the fully equipped kitchen has a convenient breakfast bar.

The Peninsula has one master suite with a king bed and en-suite bathroom, and one bedroom with a queen bed that has access to hall bathroom. The other three bedrooms share a hall bathroom; two have two twin beds each and one has two twin bunk beds. The twin beds can be converted to king beds if desired.

While you can set off from the villa by boat, it’s also easy to get around by car. It’s only a 10-minute drive from The Peninsula to shopping and dining in downtown Noosa Heads, and to Sunshine Beach, where you can kick off the day with a coffee at an oceanfront cafe, surf and tan to your heart’s content, and spend the evening reliving your honeymoon at a chic waterfront restaurant.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
The Naupaka gated subdivision is adorned with historical fish ponds that wind their way through the coral walking path that leads to “A Bay.” Anaeho’omalu Bay is a picturesque shoreline with calm waters and a secluded atmosphere. Follow A Bay to the ocean, where you’ll love the pristine sandy beachfront of the Waikoloa Beach Resort’s generous estate. Walking, this trip takes about fifteen minutes. Back at home, you and your guests will love Island Star’s eight king bedrooms, game room, and beautiful terrace.

Modern design meets beach chic within Island Star’s spacious, open concept interior. Elements like warm wood textures, local flora, and tropical print represent Hawaii’s gorgeous climate, while designer furniture, state of the art electronics, and stainless steel appliances provide the highest standard of modern luxury. Inside, the fully equipped kitchen is sure to inspire culinary creativity, and on the terrace, the bar with built-in barbecue will add even more fun to your meal prep.

Island Star has plenty of ways to keep guests entertained, like the game room, where you’ll find a pool table and shuffleboard. There’s also satellite television, a sound system, and Wi-Fi inside. On the terrace, you’ll love cooling off in the swimming pool, and relaxing in the hot tub. Sun loungers are positioned all around the terrace, so it’s easy to find the perfect spot to work on your tan. There’s also a fire pit and tiki torches in the backyard, in case you feel like having your own Luau.

Within a few miles of Waikoloa’s estate, you’ll find something fun for everyone in your group. If you’re traveling with children, swimming with Dolphins at Hawaii Dolphin Quest is an unforgettable experience. If there’s a golfer in the group, Francis H. Li Brown North, and South Golf Course is just six miles from home. There are several restaurants and bars in the area as well, one of the closest is the Tropics Ale House, featuring a huge selection of craft beers. And, larger cities, Kona and Waimea are both around thirty-miles away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
A marriage of modern design and the grand tradition of Hawaiian lodges, this seaside villa offers a peaceful getaway on Hawaii’s west coast. Beside a sheltered, sandy beach, guests can take in blazing sunsets from expansive grounds and tiered terraces. With creative interiors and decor, as well as no expenses-spared comfort, dramatic beaches and Hapuna Beach State Park are just a short drive away.

Kahieluana has been custom-built with taking in the island’s fiery sunsets in mind. Guests are able to do so from the nearby sheltered black sand beach, or with a drink in hand from one of the coastal mansion’s several balconies. The home’s slatted wooden exterior casts dreamy shadows over the luxuriously outfitted living room, where towering green foliage covers one wall, while the cheerful and colorful bathrooms are a joy to luxuriate in after a long beach day. Sunlit walkways and the sand and palm trees that sit alongside the shimmering pool add a sense of tropical peace to this home.

Set in the dynamic western coast of the Hawaii Islands’ largest island, the landscape around Kahieluana is dominated by the Pacific Ocean. Go for evening strolls and bike rides along nearby winding lanes and roads, with the sea breeze blowing softly through the rocky landscape. Guests can swim with turtles on one of the several excellent nearby beaches, including Hapuna Beach, a renowned surfing spot and natural park, while a number of established golf courses are also conveniently close by. 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Palms rustling in the breeze, mountains sloping down to green fields, and the sea sparkling in the distance make this contemporary villa feel like it’s set on a little piece of Bali. The architecture adds to the illusion, with a sloping roof over the great room and balconies hiding daybeds. But in fact it’s in the Australian countryside, near the beaches and surfing spots of hot-spot Byron Bay.

Trees mark the corners of a swimming pool that seems to stretch off the hillside, while a multi-level terrace with alfresco sitting and dining areas follows the slope. It’s easy to entertain friends and family here, serving drinks from the outdoor bar and dinner from the outdoor kitchen.

Even the great room feels immersed in the landscape, thanks to fold-away glass walls in the living area, louvered windows in the dining area, and a pass-through from the fully equipped kitchen. Dark woods and crisp whites invoke the tropical luxury pioneered by Bali’s resorts.

Spread out not just in the great room, but in the 3 main-house bedrooms, a separate guest-house bedroom, and a bunk room perfect for children.

From the villa’s setting in rural Wilsons Creek, it’s about 25 kilometers to Byron Bay and its beaches. Go swimming and surfing, spot humpback whales and dolphins, and walk to the iconic Cape Byron Lighthouse, the easternmost point in Australia. In town, stop at bakeries turning out flaky croissants and restaurants firing up pizzas.

 Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Villa Umah Daun is an exceptional vacation rental located in the Umalas area of Bali. This private luxury home has been skillfully sculpted from interlinking pavilions arranged in an arc around the grounds. Conceived by noted Balinese architect, Komang Suardika of Jeghier Architect, the villa’s generous living areas appear to extend beyond their glass doors and across the shallow pond that flows around the contours of the pavilion. Experience the best of Bali with Luxury Retreats!

Villa Umah Daun offers huge family appeal. Youngsters will gravitate to the beanbag-strewn playroom, wading pool and tree house, while even ‘big kids’ will appreciate the media room, games room, 50-foot swimming pool and adjacent hot tub. There are myriad toys for adults too, among them a Sonos multi-zone sound system and a climate-controlled wine room. Working discreetly behind the scenes, the villa’s nine-strong staff includes an accomplished chef who can whip up tasty meals from an extensive suggestion menu.

Emulating the form of the surrounding rice terraces, this villa showcases an uncompromisingly modern design softened with graciously curved walls and use of natural materials such as andesite rock, merbau wood and marble floors and bowed bengkirai wood roofs that bring to mind the leaves for which the villa has been named. The massive dining table will be the focus for many fabulous feasts, while the poolside bale is perfect for less formal meals. And while there’s an abundance of social living space, it’s countered with quiet corners – library, bedroom balconies and a rooftop terrace – to take a break from the crowd.

Five stunning and colorful bedrooms accommodate up to twelve guests at this non-smoking holiday home. All of the whimsically named bedrooms offer king size beds, en-suite bathrooms and ceiling fans. Other perks include a bidet and balcony in the master suite, two suites with lounge areas and two suites with direct terrace access.

While Villa Umah Daun represents a world unto itself, guests are only a short drive away from Bali’s famed sunset beaches and Seminyak’s uber-hip boutiques, spas, restaurants and bars. You’ll also find the Nirwana Bali Golf Club within driving distance of this exquisite property. Whether for an unforgettable corporate retreat, an over-the-top honeymoon or an impressive wedding, this villa makes a great bet!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
One-eighty-degree views stretch beyond a 60-square-meter pool at this traditional villa perched atop Jimbaran Hill. The verdant Bali countryside unfurls in front of an open-sided living area designed by prominent Indonesian architect Popo Danes and overseen by a full staff. Do laps in your own pool or make the 10-minute drive to swim, surf, and dine on seafood at Jimbaran Beach.

 

During your holiday at The Longhouse, a chef, butler, and housekeeper will pamper you, and you’ll have private access to boutique-hotel-worthy amenities from an infinity pool and yoga area to a barbecue and al-fresco wet bar. This luxury property also features a home gym and spa area, plus a smart TV, surround-sound system, and Wi-Fi.

 

The living areas at this vacation rental are set in an open-sided pavilion with a traditional alang-alang roof. Reconnect with friends and family around a dining table for 14, or catch up on reading in one of the quiet lounge areas. Though chef service is included in your stay, the villa does have a fully equipped kitchen.

 

The Longhouse has 3 bedrooms with king beds, including one that feels like a honeymoon suite with its al-fresco shower and plunge pool. There are also 2 bedrooms with 2 twin beds each, and one bedroom with a queen bed. All 6 bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms.

 

The villa’s location in the Kuta Selatan area gives you a taste of the real Bali. The closest town is Jimbaran, a 10-minute drive away, where you can spend a day on the white-sand beach, browse for the perfect souvenir in the shops, or join the locals in one of the many celebrations that still take place at the temple in front of the town’s market. For more restaurant options or a night out on the town, it’s a 30-minute drive to Seminyak.

 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Taman Ahimsa translates to ‘Garden of Peace,’ an apt name for this luxury villa, as visitors will attest to the estate’s abundant tropical gardens featuring fruit-bearing trees and vibrantly colored plants. Situated on a beachfront strip of the Cemagi coast in southwestern Bali, the estate offers accommodations for up to fourteen visitors in its seven regal guest suites featuring many natural components. Taman Ahimsa itself is a microcosm of Bali, a place of beauty where questions you never knew you had will be answered.

Most people are used to chlorinated pools, but guests staying at Taman Ahimsa will get to experience the rare pleasure of swimming in an ionized pool, which – above all else – will be a healthier experience. The sundeck is a multipurpose area great for lounging around, or engaging in yoga and martial arts. The estate provides guests with canoes, bicycles and even a telescope for some inspired stargazing. Indoors, the villa features the latest in entertainment technology, with multiple units spread throughout the home, and Wi-Fi access.

The villa uses organic materials for building components that further enhance the tropical ambience created by the natural surroundings. This approach is accomplished through the high-vaulted ceilings made of grass-thatched roofs, the rattan furniture, the natural stone and the bamboo veneers as well as Indonesian artworks and ornate Balinese fabrics. The gourmet kitchen features a juicer, blender and coffee maker to get your mornings done right.

Each of the seven guest suites at Taman Ahimsa have whimsical names after the various chakras or energy points found in Hinduism. Each room has a king size bed, a full and luxurious en-suite bathroom, air conditioning, fans, stereo, security safes and private terraces. Four of the five rooms on the first level have beautiful alfresco showers – a truly refreshing experience!

The south of Bali has almost too many fantastic sites to experience in one trip alone. Luckily Taman Ahimsa is in proximity to Nirwana Golf Course, one of the most esteemed courses in the whole of Asia. The course is adjacent to Tanah Lot, a mystical sea temple revered by the Balinese and open to visitors. For a bit more excitement, be sure to check out nearby Seminyak and indulge in its spirited nightlife, delicious restaurants and ample shopping. The splendors of Bali await!

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Named for the ancient Sanskrit word for ‘peace,’ Samadhana offers a true escape to the Balinese countryside. Set on nearly two acres of professionally designed gardens in the seaside village of Ketewel, the villa is a private retreat, but within a short drive of Sanur and Ubud. With staff including a chef and butler and five bedrooms spread out between a master suite pavilion, main house and guest house, the property is perfect for special events, family vacations and romantic getaways alike.

The villa’s gorgeous outdoor spaces mean you can enjoy Bali’s tropical climate in luxury. Open-sided living and dining pavilions let the breezes waft through, and a terrace with chaise longues, daybeds and ocean views is a sunny spot to lounge by the 25-meter lap pool. There’s a barbecue for al-fresco meals, an outdoor shower for post-swim rinses, and an outdoor bar and pool table for entertainment. Inside, Samadhana has a sound system, telephone for local calls, Wi-Fi and air conditioning.

The airy outdoor living spaces have contemporary furnishings with traditional Balinese style, from teak dining sets to sumptuous daybeds. The interiors are a bit more eclectic, with wicker sofas, clean-lined tables and shelves and shoji-inspired screens creating privacy. Vaulted ceilings throughout add to the sense of spaciousness. The fully equipped galley-style kitchen has storage and appliances concealed behind sleek pale wood paneling.

To ensure comfort, all bedrooms at Samadhana have air conditioning and ceiling fans. The separate master bedroom pavilion has a king bed, en-suite bathroom, separate garden bathroom with outdoor shower, sitting area, a balcony and ocean views. The main house has two bedrooms that share a bathroom and have balcony access; one has a queen bed and the other has two twin beds. The guest house has two bedrooms with queen beds, en-suite bathrooms, sitting areas and balcony access.

From the villa, it’s a 13 km drive to Sanur, 7 km to the Bali Safari, Marine Park and Sukawati Art Market, 13 km to Kuta, 14 km to Waterbom Bali Waterslides, 17 km to Ubud and 24 km to Seminyak. Head to Jalan Petitenget, 19 km away, for restaurants and shopping or Nirwana Bali Golf Course, 10 km away, for a round. The closest beach is Pabean, a 5-minute walk away; Legian Beach is 15 km away and Seminyak Beach is 16 km away. The Ngurah Rai International Airport is about 27 km away.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: The stretch of beach between Sanur and Ketewel is well known as a surfer’s heaven (especially from November to May, when the winds turn offshore on this side of the island), but beginners should beware of strong, swirling currents. Good breaks can be found at Keramas, Ketewel and Cucukan.

Just off the mainland are the islands of Nusa Lembongan and Nusa Penida – both famous for their scuba diving and snorkeling, with excellent dive sites and rich marine life. Boat trips from Sanur or Padangbai can easily be arranged. Further along the east coast, Amed and Tulamben offer isolated reefs – the latter, also has shipwreck diving.

An annual international kite festival takes place at Padang Galak beach (just north of Sanur) every July. Traditional Balinese giant kites up to ten meters in length are made and flown competitively by teams from different villages around Bali. Originally, these kites were intended to send a message to the Hindu Gods to create abundant crops and harvests.

listing.listing_description:
Make the most of your Bali holiday with a stay at The Beji. This spacious vacation rental is a private retreat close to restaurants, the beach and the Canggu Club, and has a full staff to see to all your needs. Reserve this expansive luxury property and its six bedrooms for a family reunion, a getaway with a group of friends or even an intimate tropical destination wedding.

Your stay includes the services of a villa manager, housekeeper, and chef. Of course, The Beji has its own verdant gardens with a pool, al-fresco lounging and dining areas, a tennis court and a scaled-down soccer field. Inside, you’ll find a cable TV, DVD player, sound system and Wi-Fi.

Laid out as a series of pavilions around a lush lawn, the villa offers plenty of both communal and secluded space. The heart of the property is an elevated, open-air living room, where you can stretch out on the sofas while warm breezes waft through. The adjacent dining room has seating for twelve, and the nearby kitchen is fully equipped. There’s also a cozy media room upstairs where kids—or grown-ups—can unwind with a favorite movie.

Each of the villa’s six bedrooms is a honeymoon-worthy haven set in its own pavilion, and has an en-suite bathroom, terrace, and gorgeous details such as parquet floors. There are two master suites with king beds and semi-outdoor bathrooms to rival those at any spa, two bedrooms with queen beds and al-fresco showers, and two bedrooms with two twin beds each.

The Beji is just a 10-minute walk from the Finns Recreation Club, which has everything from waterslides and trampolines to pilates and yoga. It’s also a short drive to great restaurants, popular beaches such as Berawa and Seminyak, as well as other sports facilities like the Bali Equestrian Center and the nearest golf course.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Arnalaya means ‘rhythm of the waves’ in Sanskrit, and this chic retreat with its dream location seamlessly cultivates that illusive sense of harmony. This fabulous contemporary tropical retreat was brought to life by architect Sonny Chan and interior designer Albano Daminato. Arnalaya Beach House is a sophisticated yet supremely relaxed, family-friendly villa in Bali’s beautiful Canggu district, with a large team of staff on hand to ensure that every whim is gracefully met.

From the Zen-like garden with steps and fish-filled lotus ponds to the mirage-like infinity swimming pool, every detail has been conceived to please your senses and relax your mind. An oceanfront garden pavilion offers alfresco seating, a built-in barbeque and dining for fourteen overlooking the Indian Ocean. The private tennis court is action ready and the spa pampers and polishes, while the lush gardens bowed with fragrant tropical flowers bring blissful repose. Little could be more restorative than a yoga session in this environment, on one of the platforms provided. The exteriors are all positioned to catch the magical sunrises and the Hindu rituals at the neighboring temple.

The entertainment room is a real showstopper and will be a hotspot for the entire family. In a separate wing, along with three guest bedrooms, it has been equipped with a huge TV screen that connects to iTunes, plus stacks of games, books, arts and craft gear. Get ready for sundowners followed by exquisite meals prepared by Arnalaya’s master chef from a mouthwatering menu of Western and pan-Asian delicacies.

Five immaculate bedrooms and additional bedding options accommodate up to fifteen guests at Arnalaya. All of the bedrooms feature en-suite bathrooms, walk-in closets, lounge areas, televisions and sound systems. The layout, with separate pavilions, is perfect for groups seeking oscillations of privacy and social time. All bedrooms have two twins that are convertible to kings, and the courtyard suite has an additional Murphy bed.

Make use of the special-rate car and driver and visit some of Bali’s ethereal temples, grab a game of golf at the spectacular Nirwana course, or browse the boutiques of sophisticated Seminyak, just twenty minutes away. Life moves at a slower pace in nearby Canggu as many locals have largely agrarian lifestyles. Excitement is within arms reach however, starting with Echo Beach lined with warungs, small traditional restaurants, and excellent waves for surfing.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Enjoy a property that has room both for events with 100 guests and for private moments at Villa Markisa at Pandawa Cliff Estate. Perfect for a family reunion, milestone anniversary or birthday celebration or an idyllic Bali destination wedding, this luxury vacation rental has a gorgeous oceanfront setting, a full staff, five bedrooms and plenty of shared amenities.

During your stay at Villa Markisa, a chef, housekeeper, butler and driver will be on hand to ensure your comfort. Host a memorable event or simply relax in outdoor living areas that feature three pools, manicured lawns and gardens, al-fresco lounging and dining areas, and views of the white-sand Pandawa Beach below. Your holiday at Pandawa Cliff Estate also includes the use of the estate’s shared tennis and squash courts, gym and spa; ask about using the estate’s venues for events with up to 400 guests.

Villa Markisa is made up of two matching two-bedroom houses, each with its own living area, dining area and kitchenette, and a spectacular master suite set into the lawn above the ocean. Though the villa draws inspiration from traditional Indonesian architecture with an open-sided bale, the contemporary interiors are filled with sleek, mid-century-inspired furnishings.

Each of the two-bedroom guest houses has one bedroom with a king bed and one with two twin beds. The king bedrooms open to the pool decks and the twin bedrooms open to balconies; all four have en-suite bathrooms. The master suite is a showstopping space with a king bed, en-suite bathroom, a living area with a kitchenette and its own pool overlooking the ocean. Its tucked-away setting beneath the villa’s garden makes it a tranquil, honeymoon-worthy retreat.

Follow a new road from Villa Markisa down to the white sands and crystal clear waters of Pandawa Beach just below. The villa’s location on The Bukit also puts you close to many of the best surfing beaches on Bali, golf courses, central areas with shopping, dining and nightlife, and unique cultural attractions such as the Uluwatu sea temple.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Get in touch with the Bondi Beach scene at this private federation-style home in Bronte, a beachside suburb of Sydney. Before you hit the sand, have a late breakfast at the backyard’s alfresco set, warm up with a few laps in the pool, or work on your tan in a sun lounger. Then, follow the coastal walkway connecting Bronte and Bondi beaches, and explore shops, bars, and restaurants on the way.

With coffered-ceilings and grand fireplaces, Australia’s federation-style is somewhat similar to that of the Hamptons. Stately furniture and elegant, yet rustic, decor delivers a warm, home-like feeling, while high-end fixtures and electronics show off Bronte’s luxurious side. The open concept layout lets you feel the gentle breeze from the backyard while reading in the library or working in the kitchen.

Backyard barbecues, pool parties, and star-lit cocktail hours are inevitable on The Bronte’s private patio. If you’d rather hang out inside, see if you can find some rugby on TV, or turn up the sound system and unleash your inner mixologist at the wet bar. If you need to keep up with any work, there’s an office space. And, the house comes with parking for 3 vehicles, and a welcome basket.

Bondi Road is a great stroll, especially when you’re hungry. If you’re in the mood to shop, Oxford Street is lined with some of Australia’s most famous fashion houses. At night, head to George Street and have a few craft beers at a rooftop bar; you’ll be able to find amazing views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
