listing.listing_description:
Read or nap under the leaves of the namesake tree at Poinciana House. Fully renovated, this mid-century-inspired bungalow uses iconic furnishings for personality and bold colors for an invitingly playful feel. Spend the day at Noosa’s Main Beach or national park, both a short walk or drive from the villa, then make dinner reservations at one of several restaurants only a minute away on foot.

 

A poinciana tree stands in a corner of the villa’s private backyard, which also features a pool, a sunny deck with plenty of loungers, a gas barbecue and al-fresco dining for 8. Cue up your favorite shows on the Apple TV or post photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi. For grown-ups, there’s a Nespresso machine; for the littlest family members, there’s a high chair.

 

Poinciana House stands out for its colorful accents and thoughtful design. The heart of the house is an open-concept great room with glass walls punctuated by bright blue doors, where there’s plenty of room to reconnect on a generous sectional, around a dining table with Wishbone chairs or at the breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen. Stretch out on the built-in sofa in the separate library for a quiet moment—or to savor the luxury of a nap.

 

This vacation rental has one bedroom with a king bed and en-suite bathroom, and 2 bedrooms that share a bathroom: one with 2 king single beds and one with a queen bed. If you’ve brought the whole gang to Australia, there’s also a children’s room with a twin bunk bed, 2 separate twin beds and an en-suite bathroom.

 

Take the kayak, paddleboard, surfboards and bodyboards out and make the most of the surf and sand on the famed beaches of Noosa Heads—three of which are less than a 10-minute drive away. The house is also only an 8-minute drive from the surf break at Noosa National Park. Walk into town for a family dinner, or leave older kids and relive your honeymoon over a little fine dining.

 

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Please note: This home is in close proximity to an ongoing construction project. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist.

Contemporary style meets stunning classic views of the Remarkables at Aspen House. Floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall windows put the peaks and Lake Wakatipu on display, while Queenstown glitters below. This spacious four-bedroom vacation rental is wonderful year-round, whether for a golf getaway with friends in the New Zealand summer or a ski break with family in the winter. And for even more excursions and activities, just ask the 24-hour concierge that’s included in your holiday here.

This luxury property pairs big views with a quiet, private location. Revel in the South Island scenery from the expansive terrace, where a sitting area, barbecue, al-fresco fireplace and hot tub invite you to make an evening of it. Inside, entertain by the wet bar or relax in the media room, catch a favorite show or important game on Sky TV, set the mood with the sound system, rejuvenate both body and spirit in the sauna or cozy up to the fireplace.

An open layout around a central great room means the views from Aspen House are on display in the living area, dining area and fully equipped kitchen. The sleek, window-lined rooms are warmed by natural textures of stone, leather and wood, from the fireplace surround and lounge chairs to the farmhouse-inspired dining table. A bar area separate from the kitchen and a convenient-and-chic island make it easy for guests to mingle.

Each of the villa’s bedrooms is its own retreat with an en-suite bathroom, private balcony and plenty of those views over the lake and mountains. There are three bedrooms with king beds, including the master suite, and one with a queen bed.

With its dramatic landscape and vibrant scene, the Queenstown area has plenty to offer to travelers from thrill-seekers to families to honeymooners, and your concierge is more than happy to help you find the perfect day trip or outdoor adventure. Test your skill on the golf course during the summer or on the ski slopes during the winter. Try your luck at Skycity Casino, or just enjoy a night out discovering Queenstown’s shopping and dining.

Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
Some of the finest materials from around the world came together to build this contemporary villa, but the beach views are signature Bali. Spot petrified wood, American oak, Italian Carrara marble, and Australian window treatments throughout the breezy open-concept interiors. Follow the steps down to the private beach and walk the black sands of Cemagi, or visit Seminyak and the Tanah Lot temple.

 Your holiday at this luxury property begins with an airport transfer and welcome drink, and includes chef, driver, and housekeeping services. When you’re not on the beach, there are inviting outdoor living areas with an infinity pool, lounging and dining areas, a barbecue, a ping-pong table, and a wet bar. In the evenings, a media room with a satellite TV and Wi-Fi are waiting to entertain indoors.

 This vacation rental was designed by French architect Fredo Taffin, who also envisioned chic Bali hot spot Ku De Ta, and much of its furniture was custom created by Detlev Hauth, a German designer now based in Indonesia. The international influence and local inspiration show in open-concept rooms, clean-lined furnishings, and fold-away glass walls that bring the landscape inside.

 The villa has four bedrooms with king beds—two with ocean views and two with their own terraces—and one bedroom with a queen bed. All five bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning, and together they can accommodate groups of up to 10 friends or family.

 The house’s beachfront location in the Kecamatan Mengwi area is the perfect setting for a honeymoon-worthy stroll on the black volcanic sand. Try surfing the popular break at Echo Beach, tee off at top-ranked Nirwana Bali Golf Course, watch the sunset at Tanah Lot Sea Temple, and head into downtown Seminyak for an afternoon of shopping or evening drinks at one of its lively bars.

 Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description:
If anywhere epitomizes the authentic ‘Bali style’ that has enraptured so many over the past decades, it is Villa Batujimbar – a treasure-filled travel destination in itself.  This sublime property, which sits on over an acre of beachfront land, was originally the home of long-time Bali resident and Australian artist Donald Friend who, in 1970, invited Sri Lankan ‘tropical modernism’ architect Geoffrey Bawa – celebrated for breaking down barriers and creating harmonious relationships between buildings and landscape – to collaborate in developing the beachfront estate.  The Balinese palaces at Amlapura and Klungkung plus the famed water gardens of Tirta Gangga influenced his ideas – clearly expressed in the two-storey moat-encircled Lembu Bale that commands centre stage within the meticulously designed gardens.

The lower gallery of the Lembu Bale houses the current Australian owner’s astonishing collection of Balinese art – including the Donald Friend painting he bought from the artist himself on first visiting Villa Batujimbar in 1972. This private collection rivals the island’s finest galleries and museums and is a unique feature of the villa.  Guests are welcome to view the collection on special request.  Yet art is not confined to this space alone throughout the living and sleeping pavilions you’ll come across architectural treasures, rare artefacts, painted antique doors and windows, and heirloom paintings that reveal the owner’s passion for Balinese art and craftsmanship.  And within the expansive gardens are myriad moss-encrusted statuary and intricately carved stone reliefs. Bali’s beauty shines in the materials used too – vaulted alang-alang thatched roofs, lava stone steps, coral walls, and terrazzo and teakwood floors.

With such a fascinating history, no wonder Villa Batujimbar has attracted celebrity guests over the years. Today’s guests are following in the footsteps of Mick Jagger and Jerry Hall (who got married here), Sting (who gave an impromptu concert), Yoko Ono, and members of the Thai and Malaysian and British royal families. In such splendid surroundings, and pampered by a team of staff that includes a private chef, personal butlers and villa manager, you can look forward to royal treatment too.

Influenced by traditional Balinese family living, Villa Batujimbar comprises a series of alang-alang thatched pavilions spread through the substantial estate.  At its centre is the Lembu Bale – a moated double-storey brick-built pavilion which houses an open-sided lounge on its upper floor looking onto the swimming pool on one side and across the gardens to the ocean on the other.

Closest to the beach are the living pavilion and the dining bale, and to one side is the Longhouse, comprising two bedroom suites, a formal dining room and professionally equipped kitchen.  Opposite is the Bali Pavilion, with two bedrooms, garden bathrooms and courtyard. Furthest from the beach, two more guest bedroom suites occupy the two-storey Pool Pavilion and share an open-fronted living area looking onto the 20-metre swimming pool. Two additional bedrooms are housed in the Family Pavilion situated above the exercise room near the villa entrance, while a tennis court and shower room lie just across the driveway
